00015 #ifndef __MEZZO_SEQ_BLOCK_CONTEXT__
00016 #define __MEZZO_SEQ_BLOCK_CONTEXT__
00017 
00018 #include "Storable.h"
00019 #include "Buffer.h"
00020 
00021 namespace Mezzo {
00022 
00023 class SeqBlock;
00024 
00025 class SeqBlockContext : public virtual Storable
00026 {
00027    friend class BlockedSequence;
00028 
00029  public:
00030    virtual ~SeqBlockContext() { }
00031 
00032  private:
00033    virtual SeqBlock *NewSeqBlock(Buffer buffer) = 0;
00034 
00035    /// Get a reference that is suitable for use in this context, whether the
00036    /// given SeqBlock is from this context or not.  In practice this will add
00037    /// one to the refcount and return the same block if the given block is from
00038    /// this context, otherwise it will make a copy in this context.
00039    virtual SeqBlock *GetSeqBlockRef(SeqBlock *block) = 0;
00040 
00041    virtual SeqBlock *GetSeqBlockRef(Loader& loader, std::string id) = 0;
00042 
00043    /// Free use of a block previously acquired using either NewSeqBlock or GetRef.
00044    /// In practice this will decrement the reference count by one, and delete
00045    /// the block if the reference count hits zero.
00046    virtual void ReleaseSeqBlockRef(SeqBlock *block) = 0;
00047 
00048    virtual void Ref() = 0;
00049    virtual void Deref() = 0;
00050 
00051    /// Get the number of SeqBlocks currently allocated in this context.  If the
00052    /// owner of this context thinks that all blocks have been freed but finds
00053    /// that this method returns nonzero, the client knows it leaked some blocks.
00054    virtual int GetNumSeqBlocks() = 0;
00055 };
00056 
00057 } // namespace
00058 
00059 #endif
